title: Pearls in the North
creator_credit: Australian Commonwealth Film Unit, Don Murray and Oliver Howes
brief_description: Examines the pearling industry in the far north of Australia. After a post-war decline the industry now has a bright future. Nine luggers, from Broome, with Japanese and Malay crews, work the rich pearlshell beds. Shows diving techniques and a cultured pearl farm. In Italian language.
creator_credit_for_label: Australian Commonwealth Film Unit, Don Murray and Oliver Howes
